item.title: Extensive litter, 16th November
item.description:
This section of the common has been neglected for months. Bottles, cans everywhere, a dumped bed base has been there for months, cans in and under bushes. It needs urgent attention.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Philimore Close, Plumstead

item.title: Several potholes in Norman Park car park plus fading line markings, 16th November
item.description:
The pothole at the entrance is causing damage to cars entering the park. Plus there are several areas where the surface is degrading. Plus, the lines marked for parking are virtually gone in some places. There is an issue with overhanging trees but I know they are being addressed by the athletics club on the 2nd December.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bad smell came from rubbish bags and carton boards take away boxes from Beardstall pizza down Kemp court flats windows at PETER street, 16th November
item.description:

item.title: Now 2 piles of rubbish - tvs cupboards paper boards tins etc, 16th November
item.description:
Two piles of fly tipped rubbish are now in place and they are growing - it’s been a month nearly and it needs removing before more is added and / or rats etc move in - it is also a potential fire risk for the houses close by

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crouch Croft, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge leaf fall in upper Foxgrove Road., 16th November
item.description:
The huge trees leaf fall is too much for residents to deal with. The leaves are swept along by strong winds and homeowners do not or cannot pick them all up, or their bins (for which they pay) are full. It is more than the elderly can personally deal with. The Council is very proud to plant trees, now deal with the leaf fall please. We need more regular clean ups.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazelmere Road NW6, 16th November

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Letters, sandwich boxes, food remains and bottle cans from Supernova burger shop spread on the plants and the pavement surrounding Ingester place and ingester court bringing smell and fly tapping., 16th November
item.description:
The problem is the absence of Westminster street cleaning. The trees and plants should be always clean. Westminster council street cleaning should care about the trees and plants around the residential area from damaging and decaying. Please send the Westmister street cleaning immediately as we suffering from fly tapping and smell for more than three nights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berwick Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
